These #millennial #entrepreneurs from #Orem #Utah are bucking a national trend. Their story: https://t.co/2LKPLrirqF #nodogleftbehind #smallbiz #SBA #zionSBAnk https://t.co/Hlg1aZf4Ze

Re: #healthcare: "We're living longer, doing better financially & our standard of living is higher. My grandkids will not be retiring at 62, they might #retire at 162. We need to adjust our expectations on how we're going to live & when we're going to retire." #ZionsOutlook2020

Next up: Home values. "We surpassed the national average home values around 2006. Now we're at an average home value of $348,000, not even close to the national average of $231,000." @SpendloveRobert #zionsoutlook2020

.@SpendloveRobert says one of Utah's struggles is bringing the benefit of economic strength to the entire state. "We need to get the #jobs in the counties where they can do the most good." #ZionsOutlook2020
This one came as a surprise to @SpendloveRobert: #Utah has the 2nd lowest #unemployment in the nation. #ZionsOutlook2020
#Utah the 2nd fastest growing state in the U.S. & #Idaho is 3rd. As of December, #Utah back to No. 1 in #employmentgrowth in the nation. #Idaho & #Texas tied for 2nd. #ZionsOutlook2020

#Debt an area of concern for @SpendloveRobert: "We're approaching $10 trillion in housing debt. Since the start of the #GreatRecession, #studentloandebt has increased 173% and auto loan debt has increased 60%." #ZionsOutlook2020

.@SpendloveRobert says in 2020, the #Fed will be in a holding pattern unless there's a major change in the economy. "It looks like we may have dodged a bullet on the recession in the near term." #ZionsOutlook2020
Speaking of the #Fed: This time last year, they said they would raise #interestrates 3 times in 2019, but instead lowered rates 3 times last year. #ZionsOutlook2020

An inverted #yieldcurve has signaled past #recessions, that's why people got nervous when it inverted last August. How are we today? We've corrected it. The #Fed saw what was happening and they got aggressive. #ZionsOutlook2020

.@SpendloveRobert says #consumerconfidence is holding up. "Consumers still feel really good about the overall health of the #economy. As they continue to spend, the economy will continue to grow." #ZionsOutlook2020

Two biggest components of #GDP: #consumerspending & business investment. "For the last two months we've seen business investment contract. If the consumer continues to spend, then we'll be OK." @SpendloveRobert #ZionsOutlook2020
.@SpendloveRobert: No. 1 measure of the overall economy is #GDP which looks "OK" at 2.1%. "It's a little slower than we were expecting. If we can't get more labor, we can't grow." #ZionsOutlook2020

#Inflation approaching levels not seen since before the last #recession. In the 1970s and '80s, inflation topped 15%. "Younger generations can't even imagine that," @SpendloveRobert says. #ZionsOutlook2020

January wage growth of 2.9% down slightly from last month. Why is #wagegrowth softening? No one knows, says @SpendloveRobert, but some speculate that #AI is revolutionizing the #laborforce. #ZionsOutlook2020
Coming out of #greatrecession, we had 6 job applicants for every open job in the country. Today, @SpendloveRobert says we have fewer than 1 unemployed worker for every job opening. #ZionsOutlook2020
.@SpendloveRobert says #SilverTsunami -- Boomers retiring -- has a huge impact on our overall labor force. #ZionsOutlook2020

More from today's #jobsreport: #Laborforce participation rate steady at 63.2%. More #women in the labor force than men: A positive impact on our #economy & #laborforce, @SpendloveRobert says. #ZionsOutlook2020

#Underemployment is at one of the lowest rates we've seen, according to @SpendloveRobert. "It's another indicator that our #economy is operating very efficiently and doing a better job of connecting #labor to #employment." #ZionsOutlook2020

We're at a 50-year low in our #unemployment rate & it's an extremely tight labor market. Relationship between unemployment going up & a #recession. "If we see a jump from 3.5% to 4-4.5%, it could signal the start of a downturn," says @SpendloveRobert. #ZionsOutlook2020
Today's #jobsreport  said #manufacturing contracted. Why? @SpendloveRobert says there's uncertainty tied to #internationalrelations due to the #tradewar. #ZionsOutlook2020
"There is no doubt we're in the late stages of our economic cycle. The question is whether we're in the very late stages or the early stages." - @SpendloveRobert #ZionsOutlook2020
.@SpendloveRobert says 111 consecutive months of job creation is "phenomenal," referencing today's #jobsreport that came in at 145k. #ZionsOutlook2020
